meanings.definition: The quality or state of being flagrant.
meanings.sent1: The flagrancy of his lies was evident to everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The flagrancy of the crime shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent3: Despite the flagrancy of the situation, she couldn't help but laugh at the absurdity of it all.
meanings.sent4: The flagrancy of the injustice burned like a bright flame in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The flagrancy of the violation left a lasting impression on all who witnessed it.

meanings.sent1: The flagrancy of his actions could not be ignored.
meanings.sent2: Committing such a flagrancy is unacceptable in our society.
meanings.sent3: The flagrancy of his mistake was so obvious that even he had to admit it.
meanings.sent4: Her betrayal was a flagrancy that stained their friendship forever.
meanings.sent5: The flagrancy of the crime left a bitter taste in the mouths of those affected.
